paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

individual_records.phenotype_details: dilated cardiomyopathy with severe LV dilation and reduced EF
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Genetic testing revealed a pathogenic TTR c.424G > A mutation.

individual_records.phenotype_details: non-ischaemic dilated cardiomyopathy attributed to amyloidosis
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Mass spectrometry showed Val142Ile and genetic testing revealed the pathogenic TTR c.424G > A variant.

functional_data.summary: The Val142Ile variant is associated with TTR amyloidosis and has been implicated in the development of dilated cardiomyopathy.

variants.population_frequency: Common in Black patients, approximately 3% carrier frequency.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and genetic testing.
variants.additional_notes: Both patients developed complications commonly seen in amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The pathogenic Val142Ile variant seen in two of these patients, a variant common in Black patients, suggests a need for further investigation into the potential relationship between TTRv amyloidosis and dilated cardiomyopathy.
Genetic testing revealed a pathogenic TTR c.424G > A mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
